this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeCommanderRole(address)":{"params":{"account":"The account from which the Commander role will be revoked"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Overrides ark"},"depositCap()":{"notice":"Returns the deposit cap for this Ark"},"disembark(uint256)":{"notice":"Withdraws (disembarks) tokens from the Ark"},"grantCommanderRole(address)":{"notice":"Grants the Commander role to a given account"},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"notice":"This function always reverts with a DirectGrantIsDisabled error."},"harvest(address,bytes)":{"notice":"Triggers a harvest params.amount: The amount of tokens to deposit

returns._0: address Address of Fleet commander managing the ark if a Commander is assigned, address(0) otherwise
The maximum amount of tokens that can be deposited into the Ark

params.amount: The amount of tokens to withdraw

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

params.account: The account to which the Commander role will be granted

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Overrides the grantRole function from AccessControl to disable direct role granting.

params.additionalData: Optional bytes that might be required by a specific protocol to harvest

returns._0: The number of reward tokens harvested
maximum amount that can be moved to this Ark in one rebalance
maximum amount that can be moved from this Ark in one rebalance

name().details: Returns the name of the Ark.

returns._0: The name of the Ark as a string.
The address of the Raft contract

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.account: The account from which the Commander role will be revoked

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Overrides the revokeRole function from AccessControl to disable direct role revoking.

params.newMaxRebalanceInflow: The new maximum amount that can be moved to the Ark

params.newMaxRebalanceOutflow: The new maximum amount that can be moved from the Ark

returns._0: The IERC20 interface of the managed token
The total assets in the Ark, in token precision

commander().notice: Returns the address of the Fleet commander managing the ark

depositCap().notice: Returns the deposit cap for this Ark

grantCommanderRole(address).notice: Grants the Commander role to a given account

grantRole(bytes32,address).notice: This function always reverts with a DirectGrantIsDisabled error.

harvest(address,bytes).notice: Triggers a harvest operation to collect rewards

maxRebalanceInflow().notice: Returns the maximum amount that can be moved to this Ark in one rebalance

maxRebalanceOutflow().notice: Returns the maximum amount that can be moved from this Ark in one rebalance

raft().notice: Returns the address of the associated Raft contract

revokeCommanderRole(address).notice: Revokes the Commander role from a given account

revokeRole(bytes32,address).notice: This function always reverts with a DirectRevokeIsDisabled error.

setDepositCap(uint256).notice: Sets a new maximum allocation for the Ark

setMaxRebalanceInflow(uint256).notice: Sets a new maximum amount that can be moved to the Ark in one rebalance

setMaxRebalanceOutflow(uint256).notice: Sets a new maximum amount that can be moved from the Ark in one rebalance

token().notice: Returns the ERC20 token managed by this Ark

totalAssets().notice: Returns the current underlying balance of the Ark
